title: Friday Fun! Six Degrees of Stephen Coles
content:
OK,   
From [http://stewf.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002600/http:/stewf.com/) to Apple's home page, in 7.   
   
Is that the kind if thing you're after?
author: steve_p

comments.content:
Jared, you should explain the rules again ...   
there was lots of confusion last time ...   
   
bj

Stephen Coles to Apple.com in six clicks.   
   
 [And we're off](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002600/http:/stewf.com/)   
1. [Read Some Stewf](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002600/http:/stewf.blogs.com/stewflog/)   
2. [Broken Windows](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002600/http:/daringfireball.net/2004/06/broken_windows)   
3. [Archives](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002600/http:/daringfireball.net/archives/)   
4. [Safari, 8 Jan 2003](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002600/http:/daringfireball.net/2003/01/safari)   
5. [Safari](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002600/http:/www.apple.com/safari/)   
6. [Home](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002600/http:/www.apple.com/)

Actually, there's a quicker route.   
   
 [stewf.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002600/http:/stewf.com/)   
1. [View Some Stewf](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002600/http:/stewf.blogs.com/photos/stockholmtype/)   
2. Discussion at [Typographica](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002600/http:/typographi.com/000707.php).   
3. Typographica is powered by [OS X](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002600/http:/www.apple.com/server/)   
4. [Home](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002600/http:/www.apple.com/)

OK, had to stop looking for a while while I watched Leeds get robbed by Sunderland & a crap ref.   
   
Well, both the answers so far are less than seven, so neither are the route I was looking for.   
   
Now, to complicate things, I just noticed you can get there in 6 by this route too, but its not the way David went.   
As I'm expected to declare the winner, do they have to find the same route I found, or do I just have to ensure that they found a valid route?   
If its the latter, as I found that it can be done via my original route in 6, then David wins.   
   
If the exact route has to be discovered then its still open, in which case:   
Clue #1.   
You'll need to go via one of Apple's national home pages (ie [www.apple.com/COUNTRYCODE/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002600/http:/www.apple.com/COUNTRYCODE/))
Thank God, I am only one degree from Stewf.
